title: So I was just playing as Quinn
body:
Valor tagged Ezreal with harrier and i was in range, So I procced the mark, blinded him and tried to vault to get another proc off.

Ezreal then Arcane shifted away, which was expected, but Quinn, in her vault, for some reason flew around Ezreal launching off the back end of his new position causing me to fly not at a 45 or 90 degree angle, but at a 180 degree angle sending me into his tower and killing me.  

Can Quinn please get some QoL and bug fixes?

replies.body: You're wasting your time. There have been Quinn bugs (and posts on Quinn bugs) since release.
this

I don't think this is really that crucial of a bug, thinking carefully. There are a lot of certain position changes that will happen all the time in game and when you lock onto your target, and the target moves away, you still go towards the target as that is what was put into the abilities coding. If it ever happens again, I'm sure that you might be able to learn before you try it, to make sure that you are ready for any consequences that happen. No MMO is ever fair when its as big and expansive as LoL.

But, +1 for making sure Quinn has no certain bugs.
This is only one of her bugs. There are many (Q, passive, Ult).
rip...

it's true what Kitten of Evil said i 100% agree with him.

 i love quinn, i love that champion but i don't even play with her anymore, for some reason...

oh no but she is fine she can be played as a top and win the lane or mid and win. nope wrong idc of the people that played one game with her and won and said that she was fun and whatever. but since quinn was released whenever i have or the enemy has a quinn on their team someone said that quinn is basically a free win for the opposing team.

Oh no but she is fine! ok buddy kep saing that to yourself       -_-

it's ok. i've finally given up on quinn completely this time.
the fact that her E follows the target like Maokai's W can be good and bad at the same time.
if someone flahsed/dashed over the wall as you are about to E you get to go over the wall too and secure the kill.
OR if someone flashed to their tower you follow all the way into tower range and die.
the fact that when her E gets interrupted it puts you into melee range
basically means you have to use her E with EXTREME CAUTION
(why can't it just be a safe and reliable little dash like lucian or graves?)

Heyas!  So I was pretty sure we sniped this bug a couple of months back.  I will try to repro when I'm in the office tomorrow.

Interestingly, the interaction in HanarSpectre's video is intended. There are a few cases where the Vault gets confused as to which direction you should go. In those rare instances, it should direct you back to your own base, given that's normally the way to safety.
Shouldn't it simply always vault towards starting (start of cast) position or am I missing functionality here?
How about looking at Quinn's other issues as well while Riot has the champion's existence acknowledged.

Whenever you find Quinn bugs
In reality you lose your patience
Whatever you mention, Riot shrugs

You wake with the morning sunlight
To bump the thread and comment too
Just let your heart be filled with sorrow
Because you know, tomorrow
The dream that you wish won't come true
No matter your heart is grieving
even though you keep believing
The dream that you wish won't come true

Would it be possible for quinn's e to get a proper/reliable writeup as to when she goes where, similar to MF's q [on the wiki](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Miss_Fortune)?

For me this one thing right here is what caused me to be able to play and carry with MF extremely well, as I know where my q will land at any given moment, allowing for free harass. Giving quinn's e a similar priority list and cleaning up her autos would make her go from frusterating to fun and playable, for me as an adc main.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sotere,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=08iUwRKR,comment-id=0013,timestamp=2015-03-10T08:16:09.007+0000)
>
> Heyas!  So I was pretty sure we sniped this bug a couple of months back.  I will try to repro when I'm in the office tomorrow.
> 
> Interestingly, the interaction in HanarSpectre's video is intended. There are a few cases where the Vault gets confused as to which direction you should go. In those rare instances, it should direct you back to your own base, given that's normally the way to safety.

It's not rare, it still occurs all the time. The coding needs a complete overhaul.

Vault needs to be recoded to always position you back relative to the line from you to your target at initial casting & have nothing to do with what direction or angle you or they are facing.

You said you'd check-up on gameplay too, any word? Can we please get a Rioter to host a Red-Topic, "Let's Talk About Quinn & Valor?"

There are a ton of issues, her clunkiness/fickle-behavior still among them.

And her unreliable Harrier Detection Range & Q hitbox is the worst!

Also, how she doesn't prioritize Large Monsters > Small Monsters in the Jungle for Harrier Selection.

I had to stop playing her because she's too damn finicky & unpredictable... & I love her more than any Champsion, so it breaks my heart.

Please, can you help us get an actual Red-Hosted Thread started on her gameplay?

You're our only hope, Riot Sotere!

Thanks for stopping by!

Sincerely,

Eyrgos

Why is this interaction intended? It seems to me that it shouldn't be, because this isn't really something that the player can control/take advantage of. I understand that there are interactions that are intended, such as being able to go bird form, vault, proc the ult execute, and then bounce back again, rewarding good timing by giving some safety. This isn't one of these cases.

If this was something that was consistent and able to be manipulated by the player, then I would understand the intent of the interaction, but given that it happens so randomly, infrequently, and uncontrollably, I don't understand why you would want that mechanic in place. IMHO, consistency with a champion is what makes them usable.

Imagine if using a Thresh hook leap put Thresh 400 units past the hooked target, but only .25% of the time. I imagine that Thresh players would have all sorts of adverse effects to their gameplay, such as unintentionally ending up under a tower or in the middle of the enemy team, or accidentally flying over walls that were past the hooked target.

It's just really frustrating being a Quinn player when you can never tell with absolute certainty what your ability will do. Any lack of consistency of an ability is detrimental to the champion. With Quinn in particular, her E interactions are only a small part of it. The Harrier passive has a ton of bugs with it that give Quinn no consistency in the game, and it just ends up being frustrating.

If safety is the goal, then the ability *has* to be reliable. In a split-second, I'm not going to be able to evaluate whether Vault is likely to be confused or not. Whether or not this is intended, it's hazardous.

Thats a way skewed way of thinking. Yes back to to base is often save, but thats mostly only usefull for ghost type effeects, that can actually help you  getting there. Thats not the same for dashes.

Iwould say usually the savest spot is were you came from, because thats ideally w√§re your teammates are.

Optimally it should be either customable like Fizz pole or at least reliable to the Start positions. Maybe make her vault towards The mouse always?

plz just rework this ability
there's no other ability like this in the game
the mechanic is awkward, very unreliable and often gets Quinn killed.

Had to log in to upvote this. ;)

Bumping this. So very necessary.

Honestly, if Warwick is allowed to suddenly and briefly become meta, I think we can take the chance of a less-buggy, smoothly attacking Quinn being OP for a week.

It only marks them for 6 seconds to take overtime true damage when they are auto'd, or attacked by something considered an auto.

WW would just reset the true damage debuffs timer, not apply 5 true damage hits.
Even a low attack speed could take advantage of the debuff, all you have to do is hit them once every 3 seconds to keep the buff ticking non-stop till they are no longer marked, for a maximum of 9 seconds worth of over-time true damage.

It's still a lot of true damage though, over twice what you get with Chilling Smite, so long as you keep on the pressure.
The original item did flat true damage every single auto, not a DoT
Fun fact: It was even bugged. It dealt pure damage that would ignore Shields and kill you in your GA, like the fountain laser.

Double funfact.

This also applied to chilling smite :3

Poor Tryndamere...

I know that feeling too....

The E bugs are annoying, but the Q bugs are the real problem.
You hit the Q and deal damage, but the blind is applied 0.5 - 1 second later. You can get hit by 1-2 autos after your Q hits, and those that are already flying hit all the time.
And the best part is that the blind duration is already ticking down, making it a ~1 sec. blind, not a 1.5 sec. like intended.

Say you cast your E/vault while ezreal is facing you.  He now uses his E and is now facing his turret.  So you bounce off wherever he is facing.  Might get a friend to help me test this out in a custom and see if that's the case.

Love quinn but her bugs make her less fun.
